documents.text:
--- Visit 1 | Date: 2025-06-20 ---

Routine protocol visit 1. Patient ID: SB-P006.

On exam, BP is 120/77, pulse 74, wt 85.9 kg. Patient appears mildly fatigued but alert and oriented.

Patient reports Elevated ALT (severe, Grade 3). First noted day 19. Resolved by day 32. Study drug dose was reduced per protocol guidelines.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 7.09 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 10.62 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 12.97 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.41 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 6.01 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.17 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 2 | Date: 2025-07-11 ---

Visit 2 clinical encounter for SB-P006.

VS: 117/78 | HR 75 | Wt 68.4 kg. Patient slightly pale but hemodynamically stable.

Patient reports Elevated ALT (mild, Grade 1). First noted day 32. Resolved by day 44. Study drug dose was reduced per protocol guidelines.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 5.73 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 12.91 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 10.93 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.23 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 6.56 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.18 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging reveals meaningful tumor shrinkage consistent with partial response (PR). Target lesion regression of ~20.2%.

Serum PSA: 2.56 ng/mL, representing a decrease of 20.2% compared to baseline.

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 3 | Date: 2025-08-01 ---

Visit 3 clinical encounter for SB-P006.

Vitals: BP 104/80 mmHg, HR 77 bpm, Weight 53.6 kg.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 5.78 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 15.25 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 13.13 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.8 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 6.18 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.16 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 4 | Date: 2025-08-22 ---

SB-P006 — Cycle 4, Day 1 visit.

Vitals: BP 122/77 mmHg, HR 52 bpm, Weight 64.2 kg.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 5.81 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 15.68 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 12.87 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.99 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 5.74 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.24 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

CT shows disease progression — new lesion identified in the liver. Target measurements also increased (22.3%). RECIST classification: PD.

Serum PSA: 3.92 ng/mL, representing a increase of 22.3% compared to baseline.

Plan: Monitor closely and reassess at next visit. Return for cycle 5 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 5 | Date: 2025-09-12 ---

SB-P006 — Cycle 5, Day 1 visit.

Vitals: BP 110/87 mmHg, HR 79 bpm, Weight 91.6 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 5.07 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 15.16 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 17.03 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.83 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 6.09 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.23 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 6 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 6 | Date: 2025-10-03 ---

Visit 6 — MISSED. Patient called to reschedule but did not attend. patient reported feeling too unwell to travel to site.

--- Visit 7 | Date: 2025-10-24 ---

Routine protocol visit 7. Patient ID: SB-P006.

On exam, BP is 150/70, pulse 87, wt 62.4 kg. Patient appears mildly fatigued but alert and oriented.

Adverse event noted: Headache — mild (CTCAE Grade 1). Onset day 142. Currently ongoing. Assessed as probable to study drug. Study drug dose was reduced per protocol guidelines.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 3.79 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 16.51 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 15.34 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.31 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 5.71 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.28 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 8 | Date: 2025-11-14 ---

Patient SB-P006 presents for scheduled cycle 8 visit.

VS: 123/68 | HR 111 | Wt 75.2 kg. Patient slightly pale but hemodynamically stable.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 3.38 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 16.72 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 15.21 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.62 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 5.18 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.31 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (HIGH)

CT restaging shows partial response. Target lesions reduced significantly (49.5% decrease from baseline). No new lesions identified. RECIST: PR.

Serum PSA: 1.62 ng/mL, representing a decrease of 49.5% compared to baseline.

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.
